title: Fascinating Facts You Didnt Know About Poha
content:
Poha or flattened rice is a staple Indian breakfast that goes around with different names across India. Regardless of its preparations, it is a healthy breakfast option since it is easily digestible and full of essential vitamins and minerals. Poha’s nutritional value per 100g comprises 110 kcal and only 18.8g carbohydrates. In this article, we’ll look at some fascinating facts about Poha why you should incorporate it into your daily diet.

Poha – Nutritional Value Per 100g

source: Fatsecret India

Poha’s nutritional value per 100g makes it a favourite choice of people trying to lose weight and get back in shape. Let’s look at some of the other fascinating facts about this quintessential Indian dish.

Fact #1.

Whether it is poha’s nutritional value per 100g or any quantity, poha is gluten-free and can be consumed by people who have problems digesting wheat products.

Fact #2.

Poha is a rich source of iron, vitamin C and A. Poha’s nutritional value per 100g contains 67.6mcg Vitamin A, 1.9mg Vitamin C, 6.1mg iron, and 79.7mg phosphorus [1].

Fact #3.

Adding vegetables and peanuts to poha makes it a superfood. Poha goes well when made with peas and peanuts (a great source of protein) as well as other vegetables like potato, carrots and tomatoes (which are all a rich source of vitamins and minerals).

Fact #4.

Since poha has almost 1g fibre, it keeps hunger pangs away and makes you feel full for a long time. That is why it is preferred by people on a mission to lose weight quickly.

Fact #5.

Poha is also eaten alongside curd, a rich source of calcium and protein. In some parts of India such as Goa, poha is prepared with curd! In itself, Poha’s nutritional value per 100g has 13.7mg calcium [1].

Fact #6.

Poha is good for heart patients since it is a rich source of magnesium. Poha’s nutritional value per 100g contains 32.9g magnesium [1].

Fact #7.

Poha’s nutritional value per 100g gives approximately 180 calories when cooked in a traditional manner and without sev topping. These calories can be burnt by:

  • Walking (6 km/h) for 54 minutes
  • Running (11 km/h) for 18 minutes
  • Cycling (30 km/h) for 24 minutes
  • Swimming (2 km/h) for 31 minutes

Note: The total time needed to burn calories are approximated and may differ from individual to individual.

Fact #8.

There are at least 15 types of preparations of poha, based on different regions of the county. Most of these preparations draw influences from the local ingredients, taste preferences, commonly used spices and cooking techniques.

Now that you know the goodness of Poha and how it can help promote a healthy lifestyle, let’s look at the easiest poha recipe that you can make for breakfast, snacks, or even dinner. After all, Ayurveda promotes eating a light bedtime meal, and Poha is a perfect dish to have for dinner since it is complete, nutritious, and delicious.

Here’s an easy preparation to get you started alongside poha nutritional value (based on the serving size).

Ingredients for traditional poha (serving size 4 people)

  • 1.5 cups poha
  • 1 medium potato, diced
  • 1 large tomato, diced
  • 1 small onion, diced
  • 1/4 tablespoon salt
  • 1/4 tablespoon cumin seeds
  • 1/4 tablespoon mustard
  • 1/8 tablespoon turmeric
  • 1/8 tablespoon red chilli, ground
  • 1 1/2 tablespoon vegetable oil
  • Freshly chopped coriander
  • Slices of lemon

Cooking Process

  • Pour the vegetable oil in a pan and heat it on medium-high flame. Add mustard and cumin seeds.
  • Let the seeds crack, and then saute the onion and potato for around five minutes or until golden brown.
  • Add the tomato and cook until the tomato becomes soft.
  • Add turmeric and chilli to the pan and mix well.
  • Finally, add the poha and blend.
  • Garnish with freshly chopped coriander and serve with a slice of lemon on the side.

Nutritional value of this dish: 206 calories per serving, of which 3g fat and 40g carbohydrate.

Conclusion

When it comes to breakfast, nothing beats the taste and fragrance of poha. Poha nutritional value per 100g has 110kcal, which makes it ideal for people trying to lose weight. It is a favourite among young and old alike, and the best part, it is almost like an instant food since it takes just minutes to prepare!

title: Know The Benefits And Side Effects Of Ragi
content:
Ragi is one of the healthy superfoods given to children due to its high nutritional content. As much as it provides amazing health benefits, there are side effects of ragi as well. This article is all about knowing the ragi benefits and side effects in detail.

Introduction:

Ragi is a healthy superfood cultivated in the tropical regions of Asia, Africa, India, and Sri Lanka. Known by the name finger millet, Ragi holds a host of benefits which include reducing the risk of heart disease, enhancing digestion, slowing down ageing, and managing diabetes. Let’s have a look at the benefits of ragi. 

Ragi benefits:

  1. Good for diabetes – Diabetes is a state in which blood sugar levels are spiked. But incorporating ragi into your daily diet can help control blood sugar levels. 
  2. Helps in treating anaemia – Anaemia is a health condition caused due to iron deficiency. Ragi, being a rich source of iron, helps in a significant shoot in the haemoglobin. 
  3. Slows down the process of ageing – The antioxidant properties of ragi help in reducing the wrinkles and kills down the dead skin cells, thereby reducing the primary signs of ageing. 
  4. Aids in weight loss – Ragi has been super healthy taken by dieters as it helps in reducing fat in the body. 
  5. Good for high blood pressure – Ragi helps prevent hypertension and you can watch your blood pressure going down with the regular consumption of ragi. 

Side effects of Ragi:

Though ragi is beneficial in improving one’s overall health, excess intake can result in the following side effects of ragi:

  1. Kidney-related problems – People who already have an existing kidney problem, need to stop consuming Ragi due to high protein content, as it can dangerously affect the kidney functioning of their body. 
  2. Constipation – Those who have constipation problems, should avoid regular intake of ragi as it takes more time to get digested. 
  3. Diarrhoea – For people who have sensitive reactions to foods, need to take care when consuming ragi as it can cause diarrhoea and stomach gas in certain individuals. Therefore people who have gas problems should strictly avoid taking ragi frequently. 
  4. Thyroid – Ragi contains goitrogenic compounds that can worsen the thyroid condition in patients already suffering from thyroid related issues. Hence avoid taking ragi. 

Final word:

As each person is different from another, the chances of having these side effects also may vary. What one person has, will not be seen in another individual. That being said, while keeping in mind the side affects of Ragi, if you choose to consume Ragi, pick the best in the market which is 100% organic.  Hence, to ensure the best quality, buy 100% organic ragi for better use and healthy results.

answer_2: Natural antidepressant: Studies have shown that consuming ragi on daily basis helps in dealing with conditions like insomnia, anxiety, and depression. Also the amino acids present in ragi work as a natural relaxant. Ragi could also be very beneficial for people with regular migraine attacks.

Since it is a whole grain, it is an important source of vitamins, minerals, carbohydrates and proteins which makes wheat dalia an essential food choice for any health-conscious individual.

Wheat dalia calories incline on the lower side of the spectrum and coupled with high dietary fibre content, weight watchers should consider adding wheat dalia in their diet regimes.

It also has numerous health benefitting properties and we will analyse each of them. But first, let’s have a look at wheat dalia calories and its nutrient profile

 

Wheat Dalia Calories and Nutrient Profile

Dalia is not only tasty but is also home to various health benefitting nutrients. Since it is prepared by crushing whole wheat kernels, its consumption entails almost all the health-benefitting properties of whole grains. At just 152 Kcal per 100g serving, broken wheat calories stand on the lower side which is a very healthy food choice for weight watchers. Low fat and high fibre content are also very beneficial for achieving sustainable weight loss goals.

Now that we have the figures for wheat dalia calories and its nutrient constituents, it’s time to analyse some of the health-benefiting facts of these amazing nutrients.

 

Wheat Dalia Nutritional Benefits

Aside from the low broken wheat calories, it also has numerous health benefits that are a direct result of its rich nutrient constituents. Since it is a rich source of various nutrients as well as trace minerals, the regular consumption of wheat dalia has been found to have long-lasting benefits for your body. Below is a comprehensive overview of the various health benefits of wheat dalia.

 

  • Helps in maintaining a healthy blood sugar level: Whole grains tend to improve the body’s insulin response and helps in managing the blood sugar levels. Studies published on NCBI claimed the high fibre content coupled with phytochemicals in whole grains help your body in regulating blood sugar levels effectively. This makes broken wheat dalia very effective for people suffering from type 2 diabetes.

 

  • Helps in relieving constipation: Wheat dalia has an enormous fibre content that can help people suffering from digestive ailments such as constipation. According to a study published on NCBI, dietary fibre has a tendency to move across the digestive tract without getting dissolved which makes it an effective constituent in relieving constipation.

 

  • Promotes heart health: A recent study published on the NCBI claimed that regular consumption of whole grains has been linked to a decrease in risk of cardiovascular disease. Moreover, it is also suggested that sufficient and regular intake of Potassium-rich foods such as dalia can have numerous positive effects on your heart health. This makes dalia an excellent food choice for people looking for heart-healthy food items.

 

  • Helps in weight loss: It is suggested that to facilitate quick and effective weight loss, there should be an inclusion of low-calorie food items in a diet and looking at wheat dalia calories, it is safe to say that it perfectly fits the bill. Moreover, a study published on NCBI concluded that the high fibre content helps you in feeling full quicker for longer and at the same time, lowering the amount of energy absorbed from food.

 

  • Promotes healthy gut bacteria: A study published on NCBI concluded that regular consumption of whole grains such as wheat dalia can supplement the growth of healthy gut bacteria. These gut-friendly bacteria are crucial in ensuring a healthy intestinal function and help in maintaining a healthy digestive system. Since wheat dalia calories are already on the lower side, its regular consumption is going to have nothing, but positive effects on your digestive health.

 

  • Helps in controlling hypertension: Dalia is rich in Potassium that is proven to alleviate symptoms of hypertension and helps in maintaining cardiovascular health. According to a PubMed report, Potassium counteracts the effect of sodium in the body and relaxes the blood vessels, thereby effectively easing the symptoms of hypertension, as well as high blood pressure.

 

  • Helps in building and repairing body tissues: The high protein content in wheat dalia makes it perfectly suitable for vegans and vegetarians who are looking for additional protein sources to diversify their diets. As stated by an NCBI study, protein is essential in supporting bodily repaid functions and is extremely vital for the growth and development of the body. It is also very essential for the visual cycle and assists in numerous other metabolic activities.

 

Final Thoughts

Consumption of whole grains such as wheat dalia has numerous other health benefits as well. Aside from the low wheat dalia calories, it’s also packed with essential vitamins, minerals and a sufficiently high amount of dietary fibre that can perfectly you in meeting any weight loss goal.

Further research is already underway to identify more health benefits of wheat dalia, but as of now, it is safe to say that it perfectly meets the requirements of any healthy diet plan.
